metadata.title: CVE-2024-42293 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:arm64: mm: Fix lockless walks with static and dynamic page-table foldingLina reports random oopsen originating from the fast GUP code when16K pages are used with 4-level page-tables, the fourth level beingfolded at runtime due to lack of LPA2.In this configuration, the generic implementation ofp4d_offset_lockless() will return a 'p4d_t *' corresponding to the'pgd_t' allocated on the stack of the caller, gup_fast_pgd_range().This is normally fine, but when the fourth level of page-table is foldedat runtime, pud_offset_lockless() will offset from the address of the'p4d_t' to calculate the address of the PUD in the same page-table page.This results in a stray stack read when the 'p4d_t' has been allocatedon the stack and can send the walker into the weeds.Fix the problem by providing our own definition of p4d_offset_lockless()when CONFIG_PGTABLE_LEVELS <= 4 which returns the real page-tablepointer rather than the address of the local stack variable.
